Description:
WHEN SIZE DOES MATTER
If you have a large or blended family and love entertaining, this home will accommodate them all and some.
Set on an oversized block approx 1854m², it has space to spare with four bedrooms, two bathrooms, and formal lounge or parents retreat opposite the master suite. A study opens off the tiled entry hall and the spacious light-filled, open-style kitchen/dining/family basks in the winter sunshine. A separate rumpus and a multi-purpose/sunroom with external access complete the home.
What more could a family need what about a 13 x 5m solar-heated pool? Or a triple garage with internal access, and 9 x 6m Colorbond shed/workshop with twin roller doors, concrete floor, power and water?
The home boasts a host of extras like ducted heating/cooling and a feature gas log fire in the family room, galley-style kitchen with gas/electric cooking, dishwasher, triple pantry and long island bench.The sunroom opens to the pool area and doubles as a 5th bedroom or home gym If desired while the rumpus is located handy to the children's bedrooms.
Outside, the double-width block has three rainwater tanks, side access to the backyard and shed and ample room for parking caravans, tradie's vehicles etc.
Embraced by low maintenance landscaping, this property offers the relaxed, resort-style lifestyle most families just dream of.
Insights: 28 Botanical Drive, Epsom VIC 3551 was last sold in 2020 and 36 other 4 bedroom house in Epsom have recently been sold.

Description:
Invest some Love and Reap the Rewards
Where history meets idyllic lifestyle living - meet the beauty and potential behind 7 Thomas Street.
Set on a generous 822m2 block in sought-after and central Ironbark, sits this two-bedroom quaint historic charmer, waiting for your fresh touches and personalised stamp.
This century-old home boasts plenty of character and features throughout; floorboards, ornate ceilings, a separate study area and sunroom space.
Refurbishing and updating would be idyllic, with its floor plan and original fittings creating the perfect foundations to bring this abode into the modern era, while still highlighting its character.
Outside features plenty of shady trees and garden beds, a patio and 2.9m x 5.8m shed and single car carport.
Within walking distance to the CBD and Bendigo's shops, cafes and restaurants, the location is absolutely ideal, and this central investment opportunity is not one to miss. The options are endless with the opportunity to develop this site into two lots (STCA).
This property at this price, in this location won't last long.
Ironbark offers brilliant investment and return opportunities.
Insights: 7 Thomas Street, Ironbark VIC 3550 was last sold in 2020 and 13 other 2 bedroom house in Ironbark have recently been sold.

Description:
CALLING ALL INVESTORS
This spacious brick unit is ideally positioned in a highly coveted Kennington street, walking distance to all the amenities of Strath Village and Kennington Reservoir. Set back from the road, behind established eucalypts and visitor parking, the standalone property includes a single lock-up garage with roller door.
The front door opens into a wide entry, and to one side through an archway is a spacious and light-filled lounge room. Off the lounge is a large and light kitchen diner with ample cupboard space. A door from the kitchen opens down to the hallway and bedrooms.
The master bedroom is located off the main entry and this generously-proportioned room includes built-in robe and ceiling fan. Further down the hallway is a linen closet; a large second bedroom with built-in robe; family bathroom; separate toilet; and a laundry with access to the rear yard.
The back garden is low maintenance with raised garden beds and a high fence allowing plenty of privacy. A door from the garage opens to the outdoor space, and a secure side gate at one side of the yard allows easy access to the road if required.
Additional features include:
Split system heating and cooling
Wall heater
Ceiling fan in master and living
Double blinds
Stove with separate grill and four-burner gas cooktop in kitchen
Access to rear yard from garage and secure side gate
With all amenities just down the road and positioned in a quality location, this neat and tidy townhouse provides a fantastic investment opportunity. With a quality tenant in place on a long-term contract at $280 per week, there is literally nothing that needs to be done. This property is one that will stand the test of time thanks to a sturdy build, spacious layout and fantastic proximity to all services.
Insights: 5/50 Marnie Road, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2020 and 17 other 2 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
CONTEMPORARY RURAL LIVING LESS THAN 15 MINUTES FROM TOWN
*Click the virtual tour button to view the 3D matterport scan
Enjoy all the benefits of rural living whilst still being less than a 15 minute drive to Bendigos CBD with this beautiful contemporary property. This fantastic modern home is located on approximately 20 acres off a quiet lane providing a peaceful, scenic outlook.
The contemporary façade is a mix of render, weatherboard and corrugated iron and sits beautifully in the landscape, offering a hint at the high ceilings and up-to-date fixtures and fittings inside. The driveway leads to a large double carport, which offers access to the side of the home, and follows through to the rear of the property.
Coming through the front door, the entry hall opens to a formal lounge on one side and a smaller hallway leading into a childrens wing on the other. In this part of the home you will find a great sized lounge, a study nook and two good sized bedrooms with built-in robes, creating a perfect kid-friendly hub. This space leads onto a laundry with built-in cabinetry, a large family bathroom, separate toilet and spacious guest room.
This hall, and the entry hall, both open into the huge open-plan living/dining/kitchen space, offering picture perfect views beyond the external spotted gum deck, that wraps around the north, east and west façades.
The outside decked area is accessed by the formal lounge and the living/dining space and offers an undercover area to enjoy a meal outdoors under ceiling fans, year round.
The kitchen has a spacious granite overlay island benchtop with sink, as well as high-end appliances such as a five-burner gas cooktop, electric oven, dishwasher, room for a double fridge and modern industrial fittings. Industrial ACME aluminium window and door frames add to the modern, low maintenance finish.
The space also features a cosy log fire and ceiling fans, as well as split system heating and cooling.
The generous walk-through pantry offers sliding door access from both the casual lounge and the kitchen.
At the end of the lounge is a hallway leading to the master suite. Ample built-in storage in the hall, and at the entry to the bedroom, is complimented by the spacious walk-through robe. Split system heating and cooling is also featured in this private space, and doors open out onto the rear section of the deck.
Through the robe is a large ensuite complete with shower, vanity and separate toilet.
Outdoors you will find raised garden beds and many native trees that will be beautiful in the years to come. Three tanks, a dam and a bore and desalination unit (offering ample fresh drinkable water) on the property assist with water management, allowing the new owner to make use of the land in a variety of ways.
Add to this a 5kW Fronius solar system for truly sustainable living.
For the hobby farmer, the family looking for additional space or someone simply hoping for a tree-change with a private outlook, this sensational property offers a brilliant design in a simply beautiful location."
Insights: 80 Hodges Lane, Longlea VIC 3551 was last sold in 2020.

Description:
13 ACRES OF PRIVATE, PEACEFUL LAND AND A MANDURANG ADDRESS
This is a super allotment nestled on the corner of Pentlands Rd and Diamond Hill road and it is ready to build on. Complete with a planning permit to build and a building envelope of aroiund one acre, you can fit your home, a shed to the size of 149m2 and any extras you want in your back yard.
There is power and phone on the northern boundary (details can be provided) and a 2mgl water right with easy access to the large dam already on site.
Surrounded by State Parklands and natural public use bushland, this is the best of both worlds only 8km to Bendigo's CBD as the crow flies and an easy commute to Melbourne.

Address: 242 Carpenter Street South Spring Gully VIC 3550
Description:
Potential Plus!
Located close to Bendigo CBD, is this charming weatherboard home in original condition. Offering 2 large bedrooms (both with built in robes), a spacious sunroom & a generous sized lounge with lovely corner windows & decorative cornices. There's a light & bright kitchen/meals area, a 3 piece family bathroom with separate toilet & good storage in the hallway. A gas heater, split system & ceiling fan control temperature throughout. Ripe for renovation, take this fantastic opportunity to make improvements & further increase the value of this well positioned home. The property is set on a 437m2 allotment (approx) & offers a private front garden & room for shedding or decked areas. Close to schools, shops, transport & sporting facilities, this really is a little gem - live in as is or renovate to make even better!

Description:
Pioneer Rise Estate - Strathfieldsaye's newly released final Stage 2 (15 Lots)
- Outstanding building block of 700m2 in great location
- Stage 2 (Final) only 15 blocks available. Stage 1 sold out very quickly.
- Strathfieldsaye's newly released sub-division offers all services and has a lovely rural outlook
- Level 1 filled areas - filling if any is compacted to achieve a similar or better density than natural ground, so no significant cost to build on the level 1 filled areas
- Pioneer Rise Estate is serviced by underground electricity, natural gas, town water, NBN ready, planning permits to build are also in place for each dwelling. All you require is your building permit
- Growing suburb of Strathfieldsaye, fabulous community with all amenities
- Location is on the corner of Ryalls Lane and Guys Hill Road, Strathfieldsaye
- Demand will be significant so call Gavin to secure a block of choice.
- BAL rating is 12.5 for Lots 27, 28, 29, 30, 31, 32, and 35 to 41. Lots 33 and 34 are a BAL rating 29.
- Information booklet on www.pioneerrise.com.au
This fabulous new sub-division only just now released offers families an opportunity to buy a lovely block in the fast growing suburb of Strathfieldsaye. A great family community where people enjoy living and take advantage all that Strathfieldsaye has to offer as well as being only minutes to the Bendigo CBD.
Note: The Status report online shows blocks as available. You need to call Gavin on 0427 887 766 to ask which blocks remain available.
This information has been provided to us by third parties and we do not accept any responsibility for its accuracy. You should make your own enquiries and check the information so as to determine whether or not this information is in fact accurate. You must make your own assessment and obtain professional advice if necessary.

Description:
AFFORDABLE ALLOTMENT
1.5 Acres (6100m2) flat allotment ideal to build on (STCA)
6 Crown Allotments, sealed road at the front with a large dam
With power at the front and side boundary and fenced on two sides
Just a short walk to the Toolleen general store and pub
Beautiful views of Mt Camel Ranges

Description:
Bushland & Your Doorstep Yet Close to Everything
Presented beautifully, with fresh paint and new carpets throughout, 1 Woodlands Drive is sure to impress.
This corner allotment offers side access and drinks in beautiful natural light all day, taking advantage of a broad northern aspect.
This three bedroom family home offers 2 separate living zones, plus an undercover alfresco area for the warmer months as well as a generous kitchen with huge meals/dining area.
The main bedroom is of grand proportions, with a large walk-in robe as well as ensuite.
Families will appreciate the ample storage on offer as well as the built-in robes in the second and third bedrooms. Also appealing to families is the separate tub and the separate toilet.
Year-round comfort is assured with ducted heating and cooling throughout the house, and with a low maintenance yard on 650 square metres, there is little else to do but move in and go and explore your surrounds!
And there is plenty to explore, with the Whipstick & Kamarooka State forest literally at the end of your street and Lake Tom Thumb, Lake Neanagar and all of Eaglehawk's amenities a short stroll away.

Description:
INNER CITY LIVING WITH SUBDIVISION POTENTIAL!!!
A perfect property if you are thinking of buying an investment or moving in with your family!
The location could not be better. Walking distance to Coles Supermarket, the Heated Pool and Bowling centre, Bendigo TAFE, Lake Weenoora and Bendigo CBD.
The property is currently leased to a single tenant, paying $280 per week, who looks after the property like it's his own home. The lease is currently month to month so the purchaser has the option of renewing it or stay after purchase.
This 3 Bedroom house has been thoroughly renovated inside, with nothing left to do! There is a well sized garage at the side of the property which can be retained for its original use or be converted to a "Man's Cave".
For investors, the location and nature of the property ensures its value will appreciate in the long term. With no overlays and the dwelling having no heritage value - a rarity along this street, the land has tremendous potential to be developed. The current dwelling can be removed and sold as a relocatable while the land can be subdivided into 2 or even 3 separate lots (subject to council approval), all with frontages facing Casey Street.
For those wanting Inner City living and looking for an asset which holds potential for growth for the future, this property is it. Look no further!
Contact Jacky to inspect for the opportunity won't long.
(ENOE)

Description:
Step into Elegance and Style.
Nestled in at the end of its quiet Crescent sits this spacious four-bedroom 558 square metre family property, beautifully presented in every way.
Walking along the front yard stepping stones and through the wide hallway entry, the home will instantly showcase its charm.
A formal living at the front of home is the ideal spot to enjoy a favourite book or kids play area and is well lit through modern timber plantation shutters.
Opening into your spacious and light filled kitchen, meals and living area you'll admire the views of the backyard and its luxurious vibe. A 900mm Westinghouse freestanding oven, large island bench, splashbacks, cabinetry and light fittings all compliment the contemporary styling in the kitchen.
The back and right wing of the home houses all four bedrooms and a spacious modern bathroom; the master boasting an ensuite, walk-in robe and sliding doors to the outdoor patio.
Imagine entertaining friends and family under your impressive undercover entertaining area which overlooks the rest of the secure neat and landscaped backyard.
The storage lover of the family will appreciate the two double built-in linen presses as well as the storage options which flow into the kitchen and laundry. A double lock up garage and garden shed also adds to the storage appeal.
Control the climate with ease with ducted gas heating and evaporative cooling.
With Epsom Village, Epsom train station, medical facilities, schools, child care and Epsom Huntly Recreation Reserve on your doorstep, move straight in or advertise for immediate tenancy.
Contact agent Jesse Forbes for an inspection.
Internal area
180m²

Description:
Huge Block In Sought After Flora Hill Location
This charming two-bedroom mudbrick home is brimming with potential.
Located in the desirable Flora Hill suburb, and sitting on 2100 square metres. The options abound here with the ability to Subdivide the block (STCA), renovate and expand or clear the block and develop.
Located just a 5 minute drive to Bendigo CBD.
With La Trobe University just a short walk away. As well as Bendigo South East Secondary College under a kilometre away.
The property itself offers kitchen with gas cooking and meals area, separate living with wood fireplace and ornate timber panelling.
Master bedroom with build in robes.
Bathroom with shower over bath and separate toilet.
While sun-drenched patio overlooks the expansive block.
This property is only limited by your imagination, so arrange your time to inspect today!

Description:
Great Location! Solid Investment!
This inner-city gem is a stone's throw away from the Bendigo Hospital and a short distance into Bendigo's CBD.
This low maintenance unit is solid as a rock and offers two good sized bedrooms with built-in robes. The spacious living area will be the perfect space to lounge and relax and comes with a gas heater plus a split system unit for heating/cooling. The kitchen offering electric cook-top and oven, single fridge cavity and plenty of cupboard space.
Down the hall, the modern bathroom features a shower, bath, vanity and a separate toilet. There is also a full-sized laundry with direct access outside to the clothesline.
Investors will be delighted with the brilliant tenant already in place paying $240 per week and taking great care of the home.
A short walk into the CBD will mean you have endless options in this exclusive location. This unit is a must to inspect!

Are you looking to downsize and still be close to hotel, supermarket and Strathdale park?

Close to all amenities of Strathdale including parks, walking tracks, shopping centre and still only 4 minutes drive (approx) to the CBD.

This is an opportunity not to be missed, contact Tim Noonan 0413 464 949 and secure your very own premium slice of Strathdale.

Description:
Close to the Heart...
So much more than meets the eye The stunning Federation façade with tuck pointed brickwork and bay leadlight window is the first impression that represents quality and attention to detail that flows throughout this meticulously renovated and restored period home.
4 Bedrooms, luxury ensuite and w.i.r to the main
2 living rooms, lounge with polished timber floors, press metal ceiling and O.F.P
Impeccable kitchen/meals area with stone bench tops and butlers pantry
Sparkling new bathroom with clawfoot bath.
Outside incorporates an expansive enclosed timber deck with automated screens and wood-fired pizza oven, heated salt chlorinated pool, and a detached multi purpose studio/guest house or 3rd living area complete exposed feature brickwork, solid fuel heating, office, and loft storage adjoining the lock up garage.
REMARKS: Presented to perfection with absolutely nothing to doWalking distance to Girton Grammar and the C.B.D. An inspection will exceed expections

Description:
IMPRESSIVE SPACE, CHARM AND LOCATION
Located in one of Bendigos most historic, central residential streets, is this charming Victorian Miners cottage set over three levels. Behind a private front fence, a large wraparound bullnose verandah with wrought iron fretwork presents a lovely façade. Indoors, there is an abundance of character detail, including high ceilings, timber flooring, sash windows and generously proportioned rooms.
At the front of the house, the central hallway opens to two of the three bedrooms in the home both offer ceiling fans and one with a built-in robe. The master bedroom is positioned to one side of the home in its own wing and includes two walk-in robes, an ensuite and door out to a private deck.
A charming timber living and dining room is positioned in the centre of the home, with French doors leading out to the side verandah, and beyond this room is a bathroom, and a triple aspect, fully renovated, spacious kitchen-diner. With a quality finish, modern appliances and an abundance of storage options, this fantastic space offers French doors to the verandah on one side, and a door on the other leading out to a deck overlooking the tennis courts behind the home. Downstairs, a sizeable lounge or rumpus room provides additional living space, and a laundry and separate toilet at the back of the home completes the floorplan.
The backyard enjoys a high, private fence with access to the reserve and tennis courts from a rear gate. A sunny brick-paved courtyard with built-in BBQ, along with a variety of alfresco spaces, provide many options for outdoor living and entertaining. The neat and tidy garden includes established planting and built-in garden beds, creating an excellent space to enjoy.
Additional features include:
Split system heating and cooling throughout
Gas log fire in lounge and solid fuel heating in downstairs living
Original period features
Excellent storage options both inside and out, including a work shed and accessible storage under the house
Access from the front of the home to the rear
Double garage with secure access to the home
Good off-street parking
Walk to the centre of the city and primary and secondary schools from this beautifully presented property. Offering historic charm combined with all modern conveniences, this is a unique family home that provides easy-care, city living with space, privacy and style.

Description:
Wonderful Family Home or Fool Proof Investment Property
This modern family home comes complete with all the added luxuries and is sure to impress upon inspection.
This brilliant floor plan is simple and flows with ease making the home feel ever so bright and open. Comprising of four good size bedrooms, with the main bedroom at the front of the home and hosts a walk-in robe and ensuite that's complete with single vanity, tiled shower and plenty of natural light. This bedroom also comes with a split system unit for heating and cooling in addition to the ceiling fan making it comfortable all year round. All other bedrooms have built-in robes, ceiling fans and share a large second bathroom.
While you walk through the home you will notice the abundance of space with two separate living areas. The hub and centre of the home is a spacious open plan living, meals and kitchen. The kitchen features upgraded stone benchtops, stainless steel appliances, tiled splashback and a pantry.
This second living/dining zone opens up to the brilliant undercover alfresco area which comes just in time for BBQ season. The added extras don't end there. There's also ducted heating throughout and a double remote lock-up garage with internal access.
Located in a quiet estate and just moments from the Huntly IGA supermarket, Huntly Primary School and just 10 minutes from Bendigo's CBB, this home ticks all the boxes. Enquire quickly.
